name: fanatically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
informal in a way that shows that you are extremely interested in something, to a degree that some people find unreasonable: The band has a fanatically loyal following. They have been competing fanatically for years.
disapproving in a way that shows that you hold extreme beliefs that may lead to unreasonable or violent behaviour: He attended a nearby church, but he did not appear fanatically religious. When people are fanatically dedicated to political dogmas or goals, it's always because these dogmas or goals are in doubt. See
fanatical
More examplesFewer examplesYou don't have to exercise fanatically to stay fit.He is fanatically opposed to having women in the club.She is a fanatically keen footballer.
